title: Covid: Can the arts lead the green recovery from the pandemic?
description: The pandemic has devastated the arts, but green shoots of recovery may be forming - in every sense.

title: Covid origins: Scientists weigh up evidence over virus's origins
description: Researchers aim to "set the record straight" on how the virus transferred from bats into humans.

title: The schoolkids who said they saw 'aliens'
description: In 1994, 60 children at a Zimbabwe school said they'd seen a "UFO" - a BBC crew was first on the scene.

title: Week in pictures: 3 - 9 July 2021
description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

title: Fire lookouts: The US Forest Service lookouts watching for fires
description: In remote towers, US Forest Service lookouts act as an early warning system for forest fires.

title: Ros Atkins on… England’s Covid gamble
description: Ros Atkins looks at the UK government’s plan to lift Covid restrictions in England.

title: England fans on diversity in the Three Lions squad
description: Ahead of Sunday's Euros final, England fans speak about diversity and representation in the Three Lions.

title: NI ministers fail in legal bid for bonfire removal
description: The bonfire is in the unionist Tiger's Bay area, close to an interface with the nationalist New Lodge.

title: Why strawberry experts are hoping to serve up an Ace
description: How a new variety of championship berry may help farmers survive Brexit and the pandemic.

title: From living in a tent to financial independence
description: Schemes helping homeless people lacking IDs to get bank accounts are transforming hundreds of lives.

title: Harleen Deol makes stunning catch in England v India
description: Watch as Harleen Deol takes a stunning juggling catch on the boundary to dismiss England's Amy Jones.

title: Haiti president's assassination: What we know so far
description: Armed men stormed the private residence of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse and shot him dead.

title: England v Italy Euro 2020 final: No egos allowed makes this England camp different - Rio Ferdinand
description: Former England defender Rio Ferdinand says squad depth and the culture Gareth Southgate has created in the camp means he always believed they would go the distance at Euro 2020.

title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch the final?
description: Wembley will host 60,000 fans at the final, but millions will be watching on TV at home and in pubs.

title: Are lots of people deleting the NHS Covid app?
description: Are people using the government's Covid app or are they deleting it?

title: Team GB swimmers 'trolled for our small bums and boobs'
description: Olympic hopefuls Izzy Thorpe and Kate Shortman say they've dealt with body-shaming since school.

title: Wimbledon 2021: Ashleigh Barty faces Karolina Pliskova in women's final
description: Ashleigh Barty says she "couldn't be more rapt" to play her first SW19 final on the 50th anniversary of her idol Evonne Goolagong Cawley's maiden win.

title: Euro 2020 final: How to watch and follow Italy v England on the BBC
description: England are one win away from a first major men's tournament triumph since 1966 - and you can watch and follow all the action from Sunday's Euro 2020 final with Italy on the BBC.

title: NHS Covid app may change as rules change, Grant Shapps says
description: The transport secretary says the app's sensitivity may need to be reduced as restrictions change.

title: Sarah Everard murder: Met PC Wayne Couzens pleads guilty
description: Met Police chief Cressida Dick says "everyone in policing" feels betrayed by Sarah Everard's killer.

title: UK economic growth slows in May
description: Despite a boost from pubs and restaurants serving indoors, growth was below expectations.

title: BBC extends Wimbledon broadcast deal to 2027
description: The BBC extends its contract to broadcast Wimbledon for an additional three years, taking its partnership with the All England Club through to 2027.

title: Euro 2020: Sedgley stem cell donor given final tickets
description: Sam Astley, who missed the semi-final to donate stem cells, will now see England v Italy at Wembley.

title: Covid: Travellers returning to England warned of six-hour airport queues
description: Border Force staff will struggle to deal with a surge in passengers over the summer, a union says.

title: UK military not defeated in Afghanistan, says head of British armed forces
description: General Sir Nick Carter responds to a mother questioning what her soldier son died for in Afghanistan.

title: Euro 2020: My dream finish to England's story - Alan Shearer
description: Former England captain and BBC Sport columnist Alan Shearer says Gareth Southgate and his side are on the verge of greatness after an amazing month, and reveals his dream finish to Euro 2020.

title: Richard Okorogheye death: Met Police officers served with misconduct notices
description: The body of Richard Okorogheye was found two weeks after he went missing from his west London home.

title: Jovenel Moïse: Foreign hit squad killed Haiti's president, police say
description: A group of 26 Colombians and two Americans shot President Jovenel Moïse in his home, police say.

title: Dua Lipa sued for putting paparazzi photo of herself on Instagram
description: The pop star faces legal action after allegedly posting a paparazzi photo of herself on Instagram.

title: Fury v Wilder III: Fight off following Covid-19 case in Briton's camp
description: The 24 July trilogy bout between Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder is postponed following a Covid-19 case in the Briton's camp.

title: Mason Mount fan Belle 'won't wash or sell' midfielder's shirt
description: Football fan Belle McNally went viral after footage of the player handing her his shirt was shared online.

title: Covid: Children's extremely low risk confirmed by study
description: The overall risk of death is around two in a million children, scientists looking at England's data estimate.

title: Euro 2020: Best of Micah Richards - Steven Gerrard's borrowed boots feature in pundit's best bits
description: BBC pundit Micah Richards tells stories of borrowing Steven Gerrard's boots, his bullet header against Finland and shows off his vocals.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Three lie-ins' and 'thousands spared isolation'
description: Friday's papers say the NHS Covid app will be "tweaked" to reduce the numbers told to isolate.

title: Zaila Avant-garde: Teenager makes history at US spelling bee
description: Zaila Avant-garde, 14, becomes the first African American to win the high-profile competition.

title: 'Farmers can't forget what our grandparents taught us'
description: They are looking to older practices to improve meat, boost soil health and mitigate climate change.

title: Ricky Gervais: 'The Office would be cancelled now'
description: The show's star reflects on its appeal 20 years on but feels it could now be politically incorrect.

title: Photographer's shopping centre exhibition shows the authentic face of black Britain
description: Cephas Williams turns a shopping centre into a gallery for his Portrait of Black Britain exhibition.
